peripheral.name: PWMA
peripheral.description: Pulse Width Modulator with nano edge placement

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: The IPBus clock is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: EXT_CLK is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Submodule 0's clock (AUX_CLK) is used as the source clock for the local prescaler and counter. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the clock to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The local RELOAD signal is used to reload

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The master RELOAD signal (from submodule 0) is used to reload registers. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the RELOAD signal to logic 0

field.name: FORCE_SEL
field.description: This read/write bit determines the source of the FORCE OUTPUT signal for this submodule

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000
enumeratedValue.description: The local force signal, CTRL2[FORCE], from this submodule is used to force updates

enumeratedValue.name: 0b001
enumeratedValue.description: The master force signal from submodule 0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b010
enumeratedValue.description: The local reload signal from this submodule is used to force updates without regard to the state of LDOK

enumeratedValue.name: 0b011
enumeratedValue.description: The master reload signal from submodule0 is used to force updates if LDOK is set. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b100
enumeratedValue.description: The local sync signal from this submodule is used to force updates

enumeratedValue.name: 0b101
enumeratedValue.description: The master sync signal from submodule0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b110
enumeratedValue.description: The external force signal, EXT_FORCE, from outside the PWM module causes updates

enumeratedValue.name: 0b111
enumeratedValue.description: The external sync signal, EXT_SYNC, from outside the PWM module causes updates

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT event is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT event is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Local sync (PWM_X) causes initialization

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Master reload from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0. The submodule counter will only reinitialize when a master reload occurs

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Master sync from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: EXT_SYNC causes initialization

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_A and PWM_B form a complementary PWM pair

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_A and PWM_B outputs are independent PWMs

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Double switching disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Double switching enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PWMX double pulse disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PWMX double pulse enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect at the next PWM reload if MCTRL[LDOK] is set

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect immediately upon MCTRL[LDOK] being set. In this case it is not necessary to set CTRL[FULL] or CTRL[HALF]

enumeratedValue.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/32

enumeratedValue.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/64

enumeratedValue.description: PWM clock frequency = fclk/128

field.name: FRAC23_EN
field.description: Fractional Cycle Placement Enable for PWM_A

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable fractional cycle placement for PWM_A

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable fractional cycle placement for PWM_A

field.name: FRAC45_EN
field.description: Fractional Cycle Placement Enable for PWM_B

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable fractional cycle placement for PWM_B

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable fractional cycle placement for PWM_B

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Turn off fractional delay logic

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Power up fractional delay logic

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Output is forced to logic 0 state prior to consideration of output polarity control

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Output is forced to logic 1 state prior to consideration of output polarity control

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Output is tristated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Output is tristated

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_X output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_X pin represents the "on" or "active" state

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_X output inverted. A low level on the PWM_X pin represents the "on" or "active" state

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_B output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_B pin represents the "on" or "active" state

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_B output inverted. A low level on the PWM_B pin represents the "on" or "active" state

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_A output not inverted. A high level on the PWM_A pin represents the "on" or "active" state

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_A output inverted. A low level on the PWM_A pin represents the "on" or "active" state

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No compare event has occurred for a particular VALx value

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: A compare event has occurred for a particular VALx value

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No new reload cycle since last STS[RF] clearing

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: New reload cycle since last STS[RF] clearing

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No reload error occurred

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reload signal occurred with non-coherent data and MCTRL[LDOK] = 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No register update has occurred since last reload

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one of the double buffered registers has been updated since the last reload

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding STS[CMPF] bit will not cause an interrupt request

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The corresponding STS[CMPF] bit will cause an interrupt request

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFX0]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFX0]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFX1]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFX1]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFB0]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFB0]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFB1]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFB1]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFA0]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFA0]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request disabled for STS[CFA1]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt request enabled for STS[CFA1]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: STS[RF] CPU interrupt requests disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: STS[RF] CPU interrupt requests enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: STS[REF] CPU interrupt requests disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: STS[REF] CPU interrupt requests enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Read DMA requests disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Exceeding a FIFO watermark sets the DMA read request. This requires at least one of DMAEN[CA1DE], DMAEN[CA0DE], DMAEN[CB1DE], DMAEN[CB0DE], DMAEN[CX1DE], or DMAEN[CX0DE] to also be set in order to determine to which watermark(s) the DMA request is sensitive

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: A local sync (VAL1 matches counter) sets the read DMA request

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: A local reload (STS[RF] being set) sets the read DMA request

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Selected FIFO watermarks are OR'ed together

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Selected FIFO watermarks are AND'ed together

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: DMA write requests disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: DMA write requests for the VALx and FRACVALx registers enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_OUT_TRIGx will not set when the counter value matches the VALx value

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_OUT_TRIGx will set when the counter value matches the VALx value

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Route the PWM_OUT_TRIG1 signal to PWM_OUT_TRIG1 port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Route the PWMB output to the PWM_OUT_TRIG1 port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Route the PWM_OUT_TRIG0 signal to PWM_OUT_TRIG0 port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Route the PWMA output to the PWM_OUT_TRIG0 port

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Input capture operation is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLA[EDGAx] is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely. If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is cleared. No further captures will be performed until CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set again. If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is then cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Capture falling edges

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Capture rising edges

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Capture any edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Raw PWM_A input signal selected as source

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Output of edge counter/compare selected as source. When this bitfield is set to 1, the internal edge counter is enabled and the rising and/or falling edges specified by the CAPTCTRLA[EDGA0] and CAPTCTRLA[EDGA1] fields are ignored. The software must still place a value other than 00 in either or both of the CAPTCTLRA[EDGA0] and/or CAPTCTRLA[EDGA1] fields in order to enable one or both of the capture

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Edge counter disabled and held in reset

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Edge counter enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Input capture operation is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLB[EDGBx] is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely. If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is cleared. No further captures will be performed until CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set again. If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is then cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Capture falling edges

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Capture rising edges

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Capture any edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Raw PWM_B input signal selected as source

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Output of edge counter/compare selected as source. When this bitfield is set to 1, the internal edge counter is enabled and the rising and/or falling edges specified by the CAPTCTRLB[EDGB0] and CAPTCTRLB[EDGB1] fields are ignored. enumeratedValue.name: 0b0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after the ARMX bit is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely. If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after the ARMX bit is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and the ARMX bit is cleared. No further captures will be performed until the ARMX bit is set again. If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and the ARMX bit is then cleared

enumeratedValue.description: Read DMA requests disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Exceeding a FIFO watermark sets the DMA read request. This requires at least one of DMAEN[CA1DE], DMAEN[CA0DE], DMAEN[CB1DE], DMAEN[CB0DE], DMAEN[CX1DE], or DMAEN[CX0DE] to also be set in order to determine to which watermark(s) the DMA request is sensitive

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: A local reload (STS[RF] being set) sets the read DMA request

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Input capture operation is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLA[EDGAx] is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely. If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is cleared. No further captures will be performed until CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set again. If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is then cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Capture falling edges

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Capture rising edges

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Capture any edge

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Raw PWM_A input signal selected as source

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Output of edge counter/compare selected as source. When this bitfield is set to 1, the internal edge counter is enabled and the rising and/or falling edges specified by the CAPTCTRLA[EDGA0] and CAPTCTRLA[EDGA1] fields are ignored. The software must still place a value other than 00 in either or both of the CAPTCTLRA[EDGA0] and/or CAPTCTRLA[EDGA1] fields in order to enable one or both of the capture

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Edge counter disabled and held in reset

enumeratedValue.description: Edge counter enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: The IPBus clock is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: EXT_CLK is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Submodule 0's clock (AUX_CLK) is used as the source clock for the local prescaler and counter. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the clock to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The local RELOAD signal is used to reload

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The master RELOAD signal (from submodule 0) is used to reload registers. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the RELOAD signal to logic 0

field.name: FORCE_SEL
field.description: This read/write bit determines the source of the FORCE OUTPUT signal for this submodule

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000
enumeratedValue.description: The local force signal, CTRL2[FORCE], from this submodule is used to force updates

enumeratedValue.name: 0b001
enumeratedValue.description: The master force signal from submodule 0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b010
enumeratedValue.description: The local reload signal from this submodule is used to force updates without regard to the state of LDOK

enumeratedValue.name: 0b011
enumeratedValue.description: The master reload signal from submodule0 is used to force updates if LDOK is set. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b100
enumeratedValue.description: The local sync signal from this submodule is used to force updates

enumeratedValue.name: 0b101
enumeratedValue.description: The master sync signal from submodule0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b110
enumeratedValue.description: The external force signal, EXT_FORCE, from outside the PWM module causes updates

enumeratedValue.name: 0b111
enumeratedValue.description: The external sync signal, EXT_SYNC, from outside the PWM module causes updates

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT event is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT event is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Local sync (PWM_X) causes initialization

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Master reload from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0. The submodule counter will only reinitialize when a master reload occurs

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Master sync from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: EXT_SYNC causes initialization

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_A and PWM_B form a complementary PWM pair

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PWM_A and PWM_B outputs are independent PWMs

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Double switching disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Double switching enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PWMX double pulse enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect at the next PWM reload if MCTRL[LDOK] is set

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Buffered registers of this submodule are loaded and take effect immediately upon MCTRL[LDOK] being set. In this case it is not necessary to set CTRL[FULL] or CTRL[HALF]

If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is then cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Submodule 0's clock (AUX_CLK) is used as the source clock for the local prescaler and counter. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the clock to logic 0

enumeratedValue.description: The local RELOAD signal is used to reload

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The master RELOAD signal (from submodule 0) is used to reload registers. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the RELOAD signal to logic 0

field.name: FORCE_SEL
field.description: This read/write bit determines the source of the FORCE OUTPUT signal for this submodule

enumeratedValue.name: 0b000
enumeratedValue.description: The local force signal, CTRL2[FORCE], from this submodule is used to force updates

enumeratedValue.name: 0b001
enumeratedValue.description: The master force signal from submodule 0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b010
enumeratedValue.description: The local reload signal from this submodule is used to force updates without regard to the state of LDOK

enumeratedValue.name: 0b011
enumeratedValue.description: The master reload signal from submodule0 is used to force updates if LDOK is set. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b100
enumeratedValue.description: The local sync signal from this submodule is used to force updates

enumeratedValue.name: 0b101
enumeratedValue.description: The master sync signal from submodule0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b110
enumeratedValue.description: The external force signal, EXT_FORCE, from outside the PWM module causes updates

enumeratedValue.name: 0b111
enumeratedValue.description: The external sync signal, EXT_SYNC, from outside the PWM module causes updates

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT event is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Initialization from a FORCE_OUT event is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Local sync (PWM_X) causes initialization

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Master reload from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0. The submodule counter will only reinitialize when a master reload occurs

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Master sync from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: EXT_SYNC causes initialization

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Do not load new values

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Load prescaler, modulus, and PWM values of the corresponding submodule

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PWM generator is disabled in the corresponding submodule

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PWM generator is enabled in the corresponding submodule

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PWM23 is used to generate complementary PWM pair in the corresponding submodule

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PWM45 is used to generate complementary PWM pair in the corresponding submodule

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: Not locked. Do not monitor PLL operation. Resetting of the fractional delay block in case of PLL losing lock will be controlled by software

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Not locked. Monitor PLL operation to automatically disable the fractional delay block when the PLL encounters problems

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: Locked. Do not monitor PLL operation. Resetting of the fractional delay block in case of PLL losing lock will be controlled by software. These bits are write protected until the next reset

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Locked. Monitor PLL operation to automatically disable the fractional delay block when the PLL encounters problems. These bits are write protected until the next reset

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: FAULTx CPU interrupt requests disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: FAULTx CPU interrupt requests enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal mode. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the state of FSTS[FFULL] without regard to the state of FSTS[FFPINx]. The PWM outputs disabled by this fault input will not be re-enabled until the actual FAULTx input signal de-asserts since the fault input will combinationally disable the PWM outputs (as programmed in DISMAPn)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Safe mode. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear and FSTS[FFPINx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the state of FSTS[FFULL]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Manual fault clearing. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending the state of FSTS[FFULL]. This is further controlled by FCTRL[FSAFE]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic fault clearing. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are enabled when FSTS[FFPINx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the state of FSTS[FFULL] without regard to the state of FSTS[FFLAGx]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: A logic 0 on the fault input indicates a fault condition

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: A logic 1 on the fault input indicates a fault condition

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No fault on the FAULTx pin

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Fault on the FAULTx pin

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PWM outputs are not re-enabled at the start of a full cycle

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PWM outputs are re-enabled at the start of a full cycle

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: PWM outputs are not re-enabled at the start of a half cycle

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: PWM outputs are re-enabled at the start of a half cycle (as defined by VAL0)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Fault input glitch stretching is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Input fault signals will be stretched to at least 2 IPBus clock cycles

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No fault

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Cause a simulated fault

field.name: NOCOMB
field.description: No Combinational Path From Fault Input To PWM Output

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: There is a combinational link from the fault inputs to the PWM outputs. The fault inputs are combined with the filtered and latched fault signals to disable the PWM outputs

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The direct combinational path from the fault inputs to the PWM outputs is disabled and the filtered and latched fault signals are used to disable the PWM outputs
